newsitem.title: USA: NYMEX ACCESS crude eases, waiting for IPE and APIs.
newsitem.headline: NYMEX ACCESS crude eases, waiting for IPE and APIs.

text.p: NYMEX ACCESS crude oil prices eased in a quiet after-hours market, as traders waited for Tuesday's U.S. inventory report and the resumption of London's oil trade following the Easter Holiday.
"London traders weren't in and people were waiting for the (API) numbers," one broker said.
One after-hours player lowered crude by selling over 200 lots, moving to exploit the May-June spread.
NYMEX May crude traded $20.25, down 16 cents, several hours into ACCESS. About 1,400 lots traded overall and 820 in the front month.
NYMEX May heating oil fell 0.17 cent a gallon overnight to 54.25, amid total volume of 100 lots, traders said.
Gasoline was bid 63.20 cents, offered 63.25, after settling at 63.22 cents. Volume stood at four lots overall.
